%% LyX 2.3.6.1 created this file.  For more info, see http://www.lyx.org/.
%% Do not edit unless you really know what you are doing.
\documentclass[10pt,english,aspectratio=169]{beamer}
\renewcommand{\sfdefault}{cmss}
\usepackage{float}
\usepackage{booktabs}

\makeatletter

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% LyX specific LaTeX commands.
%% Because html converters don't know tabularnewline
\providecommand{\tabularnewline}{\\}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% Textclass specific LaTeX commands.
% this default might be overridden by plain title style
\newcommand\makebeamertitle{\frame{\maketitle}}%
% (ERT) argument for the TOC
\AtBeginDocument{%
  \let\origtableofcontents=\tableofcontents
  \def\tableofcontents{\@ifnextchar[{\origtableofcontents}{\gobbletableofcontents}}
  \def\gobbletableofcontents#1{\origtableofcontents}
}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% User specified LaTeX commands.
\usetheme[numbering=fraction,progressbar=frametitle,subsectionpage=progressbar,block=fill]{metropolis}
\makeatletter
\setlength{\metropolis@progressinheadfoot@linewidth}{1.5pt}
\setlength{\metropolis@progressonsectionpage@linewidth}{1.5pt}
\g@addto@macro\normalsize{%
  \setlength\abovedisplayskip{-5pt}
  \setlength\abovedisplayshortskip{-5pt}
}
\makeatother

\definecolor{CrimsonRed}{HTML}{861919}
\definecolor{Flirt}{HTML}{AA1270}
\definecolor{Kobi}{HTML}{F8ABDB}
\colorlet{red}{CrimsonRed}
\colorlet{purple}{Flirt}
\colorlet{pink}{Kobi}

\setbeamercolor{progress bar}{fg=Flirt,bg=Kobi}
\setbeamercolor{normal text}{bg=white}
\setbeamercolor{palette primary}{%
  bg=CrimsonRed,
  fg=white
}
\setbeamercolor{titlelike}{use=normal text, fg=CrimsonRed}
\setbeamercolor{item}{fg=CrimsonRed}
\setbeamercolor*{block title}{bg=purple!85!fg!20}


\usepackage{xeCJK}
\usefonttheme{professionalfonts}
\setbeamercovered{transparent}
\setbeamertemplate{section in toc}[sections numbered]

\geometry{papersize={17.6cm,9.9cm}}
\bibliographystyle{abbrv}

\makeatother

\usepackage{babel}
\usepackage[bibstyle=authoryear,citestyle=phys]{biblatex}
\addbibresource{ref.bib}
\begin{document}
\title{TPLinkish Beamer Setup}
\author{Allan Chain}
\institute{School of Magicks, Peking University}
\makebeamertitle

\section{Introduction}
\begin{frame}{How it feels}

Yes, it's just a typical Metropolis look.
\begin{description}
\item [{Metropolis}] A modern \LaTeX Beamer theme.
\end{description}
\begin{minipage}[t]{0.45\columnwidth}%
\begin{itemize}
\item Plain
\item Clean
\item Mordern
\end{itemize}
%
\end{minipage}\hspace*{\fill}%
\begin{minipage}[t]{0.45\columnwidth}%
\begin{enumerate}
\item Plain
\item Clean
\item Mordern
\end{enumerate}
%
\end{minipage}
\end{frame}
%
\begin{frame}{Boxes}

The boxes are seldomly used.
\begin{block}{Default Block}

This is a default block.
\end{block}
\begin{exampleblock}{Example Block}

This is an example block.
\end{exampleblock}
\begin{alertblock}{Alert Block}

This is an alert block.
\end{alertblock}
\end{frame}
%
\begin{frame}{Tables}

Tables are trivial. Here is a centered table.

\begin{table}[H]
\caption{Example Table}

\begin{centering}
\begin{tabular}{cccc}
\toprule 
Kingdom & Horses & Wheat & Villagers\tabularnewline
\midrule
\midrule 
Roma & 67 & 75 & 129\tabularnewline
\midrule 
Inglend & 45 & 46 & 153\tabularnewline
\midrule 
Endya & 31 & 34 & 83\tabularnewline
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\par\end{centering}
\end{table}
\end{frame}
%
\begin{frame}{Colors}

\textcolor{red}{Red}, \textcolor{purple}{purple}, and \textcolor{pink}{pink}
are modified.

You can use them to \textbf{\textcolor{purple}{emphasize}} some contents.

\textcolor{pink}{Pink is typically use for some unimportant side notes.}
\end{frame}
%
\begin{frame}{References}

\nocite{*}
\printbibliography[heading=none]
\end{frame}
%
\begin{frame}[standout]

{\LARGE{}Thank You!}{\LARGE\par}

This is a standout page.

\end{frame}

\end{document}
